io.requery.meta

Interface Attribute<T,V>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - entity type
    V - value type
    All Superinterfaces:
    Expression<V>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    QueryAttribute<T,V>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AttributeBuilder, CollectionAttributeBuilder, ListAttributeBuilder, MapAttributeBuilder, ResultAttributeBuilder, SetAttributeBuilder

    public interface Attribute<T,V>
extends Expression<V>
    Represents information about an attribute on a specific Type.

    • Method Summary

        type

    • Method Detail

      • name

        String name()
        Specified by:
        name in interface Expression<V>
        Returns:
        the type name, not this can be different from the member/field name.

      • classType

        Class<V> classType()
        Specified by:
        classType in interface Expression<V>
        Returns:
        the type of Class this attribute holds.

      • declaringType

        Type<T> declaringType()
        Returns:
        The Type that contains this attribute.

      • fieldAccess

        Field<T,V> fieldAccess()
        Returns:
        the Field representing access to this attribute.

      • isLazy

        boolean isLazy()
        Returns:
        true if this attribute is lazily loaded, false otherwise.

      • isAssociation

        boolean isAssociation()
        Returns:
        true if this attribute is a link to another entity.

      • isKey

        boolean isKey()
        Returns:
        true if this attribute is the identity for the type represented, false otherwise.

      • isUnique

        boolean isUnique()
        Returns:
        true if this attribute is unique for the given Type.

      • isGenerated

        boolean isGenerated()
        Returns:
        true if this attribute is generated from the persistent store.

      • isNullable

        boolean isNullable()
        Returns:
        true if this attribute is not required to be present in the type, (nullable)

      • isForeignKey

        boolean isForeignKey()
        Returns:
        true if this attribute represents a foreign key constraint.

      • isVersion

        boolean isVersion()
        Returns:
        true if this attribute is to be used a locking field.

      • isIndexed

        boolean isIndexed()
        Returns:
        true if this column is indexed.

      • defaultValue

        String defaultValue()
        Returns:
        the default value expression for the column. Used during the table generation phase.

      • length

        Integer length()
        Returns:
        for String types the max length of the field in the persistence store or null.

      • indexName

        String indexName()
        Returns:
        for an isIndexed() true attribute the index name, defaults to empty (auto created).

      • collate

        String collate()
        Returns:
        the collation for the attribute, defaults to null

      • elementClass

        Class<?> elementClass()
        Returns:
        For a collection type the class of element in the collection.

      • mapKeyClass

        Class<?> mapKeyClass()
        Returns:
        For a map type the class of the key.

      • referencedClass

        Class<?> referencedClass()
        Returns:
        For a foreign key relationship the type being referenced.

      • cardinality

        Cardinality cardinality()
        Returns:
        For a isAssociation() true attribute the type of relation being represented.

      • referentialAction

        ReferentialAction referentialAction()
        Returns:
        For a isForeignKey() attribute the action to take when referenced entity is deleted, otherwise null.

      • cascadeActions

        Set<CascadeAction> cascadeActions()
        Returns:
        For an associative attribute the action to take when the association is modified.

      • converter

        Converter<V,?> converter()
        Returns:
        the converter instance used to convert the classType() to a persisted value and vice versa.

      • mappedAttribute

        Supplier<Attribute> mappedAttribute()
        Returns:
        For a associative relationship the attribute that is the owning side of the relationship. Note returns a provider since attributes may have cyclic dependencies.

      • referencedAttribute

        Supplier<Attribute> referencedAttribute()
        Returns:
        For a foreign key relationship the attribute being referenced. Note returns a provider since attributes may have cyclic dependencies.
